prologue-south-province-area-one.summary: The first large open area players explore after leaving their home. It's a grassy region teeming with early-game Pokémon, connecting Cabo Poco to the grand city of Mesagoza. A great place to catch your first few team members.

catchablePokemon.name: Wingull
catchablePokemon.conditions: Found near the coastline and bodies of water.

catchablePokemon.name: Buizel
catchablePokemon.conditions: Found near the coastline and bodies of water.

trainers.name: Youngster Tim
trainers.notes: One of the first trainers you can battle.

trainers.name: Student Giorgia
trainers.notes: Uses two Pokémon: Lechonk and Pawmi.

items.name: Poké Ball
items.locationDescription: Scattered on the ground throughout the area.

items.name: Potion
items.locationDescription: Multiple can be found on the ground.

items.name: Antidote
items.locationDescription: Found on a small ledge near the path to Mesagoza.

items.name: TM032 (Swift)
items.locationDescription: Found on a cliff overlooking the Pokémon Center.

keyEvents.name: League Rep Reward
keyEvents.description: Defeat 8 trainers in South Province (Area One) and talk to the Pokémon League representative at the area's central Pokémon Center to receive TM131 (Pollen Puff).

mesagoza-city.summary: The largest city in Paldea and home to the prestigious Naranja/Uva Academy. It serves as a central hub for the region, connecting many different areas and is where the three main story paths of the Treasure Hunt officially begin.

trainers.name: Rival Nemona (First Battle)
trainers.notes: Fought in the main plaza after you get your starter. She uses the starter weak to yours.

trainers.name: Rival Nemona (Before Treasure Hunt)
trainers.notes: Fought on the steps of the academy. She also has her starter (Lvl 8), which is weak to yours.

items.name: TM082 (Thunder Wave)
items.locationDescription: Found on a rooftop accessible by climbing the ladders in the terraced gardens.

items.name: TM070 (Sleep Talk)
items.locationDescription: Found behind the stage in the main plaza.

keyEvents.name: Receive Your Ride Pokémon
keyEvents.description: You receive your legendary partner, Koraidon or Miraidon, but it cannot be used for battling at this stage.

keyEvents.name: Gift from Mom
keyEvents.description: Received from your Mom via a phone call after visiting the academy for the first time. You get Exp. Candy S, Sandwich ingredients, and some money.

keyEvents.name: Snom Trade
keyEvents.description: Trade a Flabébé for a Snom with an NPC on a bench in the main plaza.

keyEvents.name: Soothing Bell
keyEvents.description: Show a friendly Pokémon to an NPC with a Marill near the western Pokémon Center to receive a Soothing Bell.

keyEvents.name: Tera Shard Reward
keyEvents.description: After winning your first gym badge, speak to the chef in the Treasure Eatery to receive 50 Normal Tera Shards.

south-province-area-two.summary: A large area connecting Mesagoza to Cortondo, characterized by its sprawling olive groves and rocky paths. It's a crucial training ground before the first Gym, introducing several new Pokémon species.

catchablePokemon.name: Bounsweet
catchablePokemon.conditions: Can be found falling from trees.

catchablePokemon.name: Oinkologne
catchablePokemon.conditions: Can be found in both male and female forms.

trainers.name: Student Elena
trainers.notes: Uses two Pokémon: Smoliv (Lvl 11) and Nacli (Lvl 11).

trainers.name: Picnicker Irene
trainers.notes: Her Fidough can be deceptively bulky.

items.name: TM001 (Take Down)
items.locationDescription: Found on a high cliff near the Cortondo path.

items.name: Super Potion
items.locationDescription: Multiple can be found on the ground.

keyEvents.name: League Rep Reward
keyEvents.description: Defeat 5 trainers in South Province (Area Two) and talk to the Pokémon League representative at the Pokémon Center to receive a Covert Cloak.

west-province-area-one-south.summary: A windy, coastal area connecting to the Open Sky Titan's lair. It's characterized by large windmills and rocky terrain, with Pokémon that enjoy the breezy conditions. A good spot to train before facing the Titan.

catchablePokemon.name: Wattrel
catchablePokemon.conditions: Common, often flying near cliffs and windmills.

catchablePokemon.name: Salandit
catchablePokemon.conditions: Found near rocky outcrops, female is rare.

catchablePokemon.name: Cyclizar
catchablePokemon.conditions: Can be found on the roads, sometimes moving quickly.

catchablePokemon.name: Tadbulb
catchablePokemon.conditions: Found near the river and ponds.

items.name: Ether
items.locationDescription: On the ground near a large windmill.

items.name: Great Ball
items.locationDescription: Found behind a large rock on the path.

items.name: TM017 (Confuse Ray)
items.locationDescription: On a cliff overlooking the sea.

keyEvents.name: League Rep Reward
keyEvents.description: Defeat 6 trainers in West Province (Area One) and speak to the League Rep to receive an Amulet Coin.
